article.headline: Oregon 80, Fresno State 67
article.story: EUGENE, Ore. (AP) -- The Oregon Ducks were so impressive in their first game that head coach Ernie Kent admitted he would struggle to find something to complain about. Luke Jackson scored 20 points and Andre Joseph 15 as the Ducks defeated Fresno State 80-67 Friday night. Ian Crosswhite added 13 points and Mitch Platt 12 for the Ducks, who connected on 14 3-pointers -- two short of tying the school record. Jackson had five of the 3-pointers. He also had eight rebounds and six assists. "Outstanding first game," Kent said. "Us coaches will have to go back to the drawing board and try hard to find something to get grumpy about." Shantay Legans scored 20 for the Bulldogs (0-1), while Jonathan Woods had 18. Ten of Oregon's 3-pointers came in the first half as it built a 12-point lead at the break. A 14-0 run early in the second half put the Ducks up by 22, though they still had to withstand a late comeback. The Ducks have won 12 straight season openers and 22 consecutive nonconference home games. Jackson led the way early, making four 3-pointers in the opening 6:30 as Oregon took a 22-10 lead. The Bulldogs heated up and pulled to within three with 5:30 left in the half. Oregon's Andre Joseph answered with a pair of 3-pointers and a layup to put the Ducks up 36-26. Brandon Lincoln and James Davis then connected on two more 3-pointers as Oregon ended the half with a 42-30 lead. "They made every three," Fresno State coach Ray Lopes said. "We left them too open and weren't getting a hand up on shooters." Fresno State scored the first five points of the second half, but then it was all Oregon as Platt scored eight of his points to extend the lead to 56-35. The Bulldogs gradually reduced the lead to five with 2:50 left, but Crosswhite hit two free throws and Lincoln added a 3-pointer to seal the win. "It was a great start," Jackson said. "Anytime we make 14 3-pointers, it's going to be hard to beat us." ^
